snippet: Just under a month after the Metropolitan Opera agreed to major cuts, the opera house is swarming with workers busily getting ready for the season’s opening night.
abstract: Metropolitan Opera, just under month after it agreed to major budget cuts as part of labor union agreements, is swarming with more than 1,500 workers busily getting ready for the season’s opening night; Met will cut $90 million in expenses over next four years, from budget that has grown to more than $300 million annually.
lead_paragraph: Just under a month after the Metropolitan Opera agreed to major cuts, the opera house is swarming with workers busily getting ready for the season’s opening night.

headline.seo: The Met Prepares for Opening Night
headline.main: Labor War Over, Met’s Operatic Army Mobilizes
headline.print_headline: Labor War Over, Met’s Operatic Army Mobilizes
